flow.descriptionCdata:
68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.11cb15b8-7f92-43ae-bddd-13e177ed5182.prompt=enable TLS\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.1910aa2d-3f38-431e-b1d1-27510061516a.description=
This operation is used to send a smtp email.
 
Inputs\:
    hostname - The hostname or ip address of the smtp server.
    port - The port smtp service is listening.
    from - From email address.
    to - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients.
    cc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the CC.
    bcc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the BCC.
    subject - The email subject. If a subject spans on multiple lines, it is formatted to a single one.
    body - The body of the email.
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false if the email is in plain text format.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: true. 
    readReceipt - The value should be true if read receipt is required, else false. 
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false. 
    attachments - A delimiter separated list of files to attach (must be full path).
    headers - This input contains extra headers you want to be added in the mail. The input has a 'Map' format. Header names are separated from header values through a column delimiter and headers will be separated between them by a row delimiter.
Example\:
    Sensitivity\:Company-Confidential
    message-type\:Multiple Part
    Sensitivity\:Personal
In the above example, the columnDelimiter is "\:" and the rowDelimiter is the new line. You can define multiple values for the same header like in the example above. The delimiters can have multiple characters, but be careful that the rowDelimiter is not a substring of the columnDelimiter.
    rowDelimiter - The delimiter that separates headers in the 'headers' input.
Default value\: "\:"
Examples\: '|', '\='
    columnDelimiter - The delimiter that separates the header name from header value on the same row.
Default value\: "\n"	
Examples\: ';', '\#'
    username - If SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send.
    password - If SMTP authentication is needed, the password to use.
    characterSet - The character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: UTF-8, UTF-16, UTF-32, EUC-JP, ISO-2022-JP, Shift_JIS, Windows-31J.
Default value\: UTF-8.
    contentTransferEncoding - The content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: quoted-printable, base64, 7bit, 8bit, binary, x-token.
Default value\: quoted-printable (or Q Encoding).
    delimiter - A delimiter to separate the email recipients and the attachments.
Default value\: ','
    encryptionKeystore - The path to the pks12 formatted keystore used to encrypt the mail.
    encryptionKeyAlias - The alias of a RSA key pair from the encryptionKeystore. The public key from the pair will be used to encrypt the mail. The key pair must not have password. The recommended key size is 2048 bit or higher.
    encryptionKeystorePassword - The password for the encryptionKeystore.
    encryptionAlgorithm - The encryption algorithm applied on the key from the keystore in order to encypt email parts. 
Default value\: AES256_CBC.
Valid values\: DES_EDE3_CBC, RC2_CBC, IDEA_CBC, CAST5_CBC, AES128_CBC, AES192_CBC, AES256_CBC, CAMELLIA128_CBC, CAMELLIA192_CBC, CAMELLIA256_CBC, SEED_CBC, DES_EDE3_WRAP, AES128_WRAP, AES256_WRAP, CAMELLIA128_WRAP, CAMELLIA192_WRAP, CAMELLIA256_WRAP, SEED_WRAP.
    enableTLS - Enables starttls. If the server supports TLS or SSL, the communications will be secured by TLS or SSL. If it doesn't support TLS or SSL the communication will be unsecure.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false.
    timeout - The timeout in seconds for sending the mail message.

Responses\:
    success - Successfully sent the email.
    failure - Failed to send the email.

Note\:
1. For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
2. For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
3. You can use KeyStore Explorer to obtain RSA Keystore with keyPairs for encryption/decryption.
    3.1 If you get "llegal key size exception" you don't have JCE Unlimited Strength installed.
68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.1ad8e476-0f71-4071-9f17-2d363ffb52ff.description=
This operation is used to send a smtp email.
 
Inputs\:
    hostname - The hostname or ip address of the smtp server.
    port - The port smtp service is listening.
    from - From email address.
    to - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients.
    cc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the CC.
    bcc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the BCC.
    subject - The email subject. If a subject spans on multiple lines, it is formatted to a single one.
    body - The body of the email.
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false if the email is in plain text format.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: true. 
    readReceipt - The value should be true if read receipt is required, else false. 
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false. 
    attachments - A delimiter separated list of files to attach (must be full path).
    headers - This input contains extra headers you want to be added in the mail. The input has a 'Map' format. Header names are separated from header values through a column delimiter and headers will be separated between them by a row delimiter.
Example\:
    Sensitivity\:Company-Confidential
    message-type\:Multiple Part
    Sensitivity\:Personal
In the above example, the columnDelimiter is "\:" and the rowDelimiter is the new line. You can define multiple values for the same header like in the example above. The delimiters can have multiple characters, but be careful that the rowDelimiter is not a substring of the columnDelimiter.
    rowDelimiter - The delimiter that separates headers in the 'headers' input.
Default value\: "\:"
Examples\: '|', '\='
    columnDelimiter - The delimiter that separates the header name from header value on the same row.
Default value\: "\n"	
Examples\: ';', '\#'
    username - If SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send.
    password - If SMTP authentication is needed, the password to use.
    characterSet - The character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: UTF-8, UTF-16, UTF-32, EUC-JP, ISO-2022-JP, Shift_JIS, Windows-31J.
Default value\: UTF-8.
    contentTransferEncoding - The content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. 
Valid values\: quoted-printable, base64, 7bit, 8bit, binary, x-token.
Default value\: quoted-printable (or Q Encoding).
    delimiter - A delimiter to separate the email recipients and the attachments.
Default value\: ','
    encryptionKeystore - The path to the pks12 formatted keystore used to encrypt the mail.
    encryptionKeyAlias - The alias of a RSA key pair from the encryptionKeystore. The public key from the pair will be used to encrypt the mail. The key pair must not have password. The recommended key size is 2048 bit or higher.
    encryptionKeystorePassword - The password for the encryptionKeystore.
    encryptionAlgorithm - The encryption algorithm applied on the key from the keystore in order to encypt email parts. 
Default value\: AES256_CBC.
Valid values\: DES_EDE3_CBC, RC2_CBC, IDEA_CBC, CAST5_CBC, AES128_CBC, AES192_CBC, AES256_CBC, CAMELLIA128_CBC, CAMELLIA192_CBC, CAMELLIA256_CBC, SEED_CBC, DES_EDE3_WRAP, AES128_WRAP, AES256_WRAP, CAMELLIA128_WRAP, CAMELLIA192_WRAP, CAMELLIA256_WRAP, SEED_WRAP.
    enableTLS - Enables starttls. If the server supports TLS or SSL, the communications will be secured by TLS or SSL. If it doesn't support TLS or SSL the communication will be unsecure.
Valid values\: true, false. 
Default value\: false.
    timeout - The timeout in seconds for sending the mail message.

Responses\:
    success - Successfully sent the email.
    failure - Failed to send the email.

Note\:
1. For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
2. For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
3. You can use KeyStore Explorer to obtain RSA Keystore with keyPairs for encryption/decryption.
    3.1 If you get "llegal key size exception" you don't have JCE Unlimited Strength installed.
68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.1de9040d-a13f-4efa-a848-f0ceeae5e161.prompt=Character set\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.29e3f22c-f919-4480-bf5a-31a0983ddbcf.prompt=enable TLS\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.3719df86-5045-46d8-a511-a1b97a0f04fa.prompt=To\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.4ad2aef0-828f-4ab1-b53f-ea7018dd8be0.prompt=Host name\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.58ddbb00-ff94-4bdc-b695-ce235fb150ee.prompt=Character set\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.672c5cd8-295d-4659-8fd0-e117eb00d348.description=
Executes a Shell command(s) on the remote machine using the SSH protocol.

Inputs\:
    host - The hostname/IP address of the remote machine.
    port - The port number for SSH protocol.
Default value\: 22
    username - Name of the account on the remote machine.
    password - The password for the username. When using a private key file or a private key string, this input will be used as the passphrase for the file or string. For security reasons it is recommend to provide this input and protect the private key when using the 'privateKeyData' and the 'privateKeyFile' inputs.
    proxyHost - The proxy server used to access the remote machine.
    proxyPort - The proxy server port. Default\: 8080. Valid values\: -1 and numbers greater than 0.
    proxyUsername - The user name used when connecting to the proxy.
    proxyPassword - The proxy server password associated with the proxyUsername input value.
    privateKeyFile - Path to private key file (OpenSSH type) on the machine where is the worker. For security reasons it is recommend that the private key be protected by a passphrase that should be provided through the 'password' input.
    privateKeyData – A string representing the private key (OpenSSH type) used for authenticating the user. This string is usually the content of a private key file. The 'privateKeyData' and the 'privateKeyFile' inputs are mutually exclusive. For security reasons it is recommend that the private key be protected by a passphrase that should be provided through the 'password' input.
    knownHostsPolicy - The policy used for managing known_hosts file. We recommend to use a "strict" policy so as to verify the host key against a local file containing known, trustworthy machines. If you choose "allow" or "add" policy then you will connect to the server without any verification. If there is a Man-In-The-Middle attack then you will be connected to a fake server and the SSH commands that you send will go through that fake server. 
Valid values\:  
allow\=It will permit the connection to any hosts. 
strict\=It will permit the connection only to the hosts specified in known_hosts file. 
add\=It will permit the connection to any hosts, if the host is not in the known_hosts file it will be added. 
Default value\: strict
    command - The command(s) to execute.
    characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the remote machine.
Examples\: SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8
Default value\: UTF-8
    pty - Whether to use a pseudo-terminal (PTY) session.
Valid values\: false, true 
Default value\: false
    timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete.
Default value\: 90000
    connectTimeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the connection to be made.
Default value\: 10000
    closeSession - If true it closes the SSH session at completion of this operation. If false the SSH session will be cached for future calls of this operation during the life of the flow.
Valid values\: false, true 
Default value\: false
    useGlobalContext -  Specifies whether to enable the session sharing into the subflows.
Valid values\: false, true 
Default value\: false

Results\:
    returnResult - The result of the command (STDOUT is success, otherwise STDERR).
    STDERR - The standard error of the command.
    STDOUT - The standard output of the command.
    exitStatus - The exit status of the remote command corresponding to the SSH channel. The exit status is only available for certain types of channels, and only after the channel was closed (more exactly, just before the channel is closed).
Examples\: 0 for a successful command, -1 if the command was not yet terminated (or this channel type has no command), 126 if the command cannot execute.
    TimedOut - Is set to "true" if the value set in the "timeout" input has elapsed and the command timed out.

Responses\:
    success - The command was executed successfully.
    failure - The command could not be executed or if the command was not yet terminated.

Notes\:
1. If the SSH session is cached then only the connection is kept and not the context (variables) represented by SSH channel.
2. Hidden inputs\:
    knownHostsPath -  Specifies the path to the known_hots file on the running server.
Default value\: /.ssh/known_hosts
Examples\: /home/admin/.ssh/known_hosts
   allowExpectCommands - Specifies whether to allow the execution of expect like commands. Some protocols ( like OGFS ) do not work for regular commands if this behavior is enabled. The recommended operation to use for expect like commands is SSH Shell.
Default value\: false
3. In order to use private keys with different encryption types (ex.\: aes256-cbc) needs to be updated the /java/lib/security/local_policy.jar JAR file with one that accept all security policies (ex.\: http\://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jce-7-download-432124.html). After update you must restart the Studio or Central service.
4. The "timeout" input refers only to the command timeout and it's not linked with any kind of connection timeout. The "commandTimedOut" output shows if the command timed out and doesn't interfere with the returnResult, STDERR or STDOUT outputs, so even if the command times out these outputs will still be populated accordingly.
5. The operation supports connections through HTTP proxy with username and password authentication.
68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.67f3c95c-05c3-41a7-9a1e-992a33572670.prompt=Content transfer encoding\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.69988d0f-1d92-4e23-9782-dfe43a917f11.prompt=Content transfer encoding\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.95edffa2-fd78-4835-8833-63207fe97135.prompt=From\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.af22e7f8-7682-4703-be44-ac00fb2e0eac.prompt=Port\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.c5184928-50ba-413d-8d9a-2a3d9fd15371.prompt=To\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.d4b5cab2-76a1-41a8-ba3a-7bfd3b9cf7d1.prompt=From\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.d89a0d2d-8742-41d9-9b08-4620b4f608d3.prompt=Host name\: 68ec89ab-6b11-4b04-909d-4408e04b5d08.e6850b8b-b68e-4146-94ed-58cbf4bd5045.prompt=Port\:
flow.name: ssh test
